alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued September 21 at 5:28PM CDT until September 21 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... West central Red Willow County in southwestern Nebraska... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 528 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near McCook, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... McCook around 535 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
